soc.client

Class SwingMainDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • soc.client.SwingMainDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, MainDisplay

    public class SwingMainDisplay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements MainDisplay
    A MainDisplay implementation for Swing. Uses CardLayout to display an appropriate interface:
    • Initial "Connect or Practice" panel to connect to a server
    • Main panel to list the connected server's current games and channels and create new ones
    • Message panel to show a server connectivity error
    Individual games are shown using SOCPlayerInterface and channels use ChannelFrame.

    Before v2.0.00, most of these fields and methods were part of the main SOCPlayerClient class. Also converted from AWT to Swing in v2.0.00.

    Since:
    2.0.00
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DISPLAY_MIN_UNSCALED_HEIGHT

        public static final int DISPLAY_MIN_UNSCALED_HEIGHT
        Recommended minimum height of the screen (display): 768 pixels. checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component) will return a high-DPI scaling factor if screen is at least twice this height.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE
        System property "jsettlers.uiScale" for UI scaling override ("high-DPI") if needed for checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component).

        At startup, overrides optional user preference SOCPlayerClient.PREF_UI_SCALE_FORCE.

        Name is based on similar "sun.java2d.uiScale", but that property might not be available for all java versions.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_CONTRAST_MODE

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_CONTRAST_MODE
        System property "jsettlers.uiContrastMode" to force high-contrast dark or light mode if needed for accessibility. Recognized values: "light" or "dark" background. Name is based on PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIALOG_BG_GOLDENROD

        public static final java.awt.Color DIALOG_BG_GOLDENROD
        The classic JSettlers goldenrod dialog background color; pale yellow-orange tint #FFE6A2. Typically used with foreground Color.BLACK, like in game/chat text areas, TradePanel, MessagePanel, and AskDialog.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        #getForegroundBackgroundColors(boolean), JSETTLERS_BG_GREEN

      • JSETTLERS_BG_GREEN

        public static final java.awt.Color JSETTLERS_BG_GREEN
        The classic JSettlers green background color; green tone #61AF71. Typically used with foreground color Color.BLACK, like in SwingMainDisplay's main panel. Occasionally used with MISC_LABEL_FG_OFF_WHITE.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        #getForegroundBackgroundColors(boolean), DIALOG_BG_GOLDENROD

      • gameOptsTask

        protected soc.client.SwingMainDisplay.GameOptionsTimeoutTask gameOptsTask

        See Also:

      • hasJoinedServer

        protected boolean hasJoinedServer
        Once true, disable "nick" textfield, etc. Remains true, even if connected becomes false.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • hasConnectOrPractice

        protected final boolean hasConnectOrPractice
        If true, we'll give the user a choice to connect to a server, start a local server, or a local practice game. Used for when we're started from a jar, or from the command line with no arguments. Uses SOCConnectOrPracticePanel.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        cardLayout

      • connectOrPracticePane

        protected SOCConnectOrPracticePanel connectOrPracticePane
        If applicable, is set up in initVisualElements(). Key for cardLayout is CONNECT_OR_PRACTICE_PANEL.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        hasConnectOrPractice

      • newGameOptsFrame

        public NewGameOptionsFrame newGameOptsFrame
        The currently showing new-game options frame, or null
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • nick

        protected javax.swing.JTextField nick
        Nickname (username) to connect to server and use in games. After auth, once a game or channel is successfully joined, client calls nick.setEditable(false).

        Default value is set in guardedActionPerform_games(Object) if still blank, so Practice game can be joined from SOCConnectOrPracticePanel which doesn't show this field.

      • pass

        protected javax.swing.JPasswordField pass
        Password for nick while connecting to server, or blank

      • status

        protected javax.swing.JTextField status
        Status from server, or progress/error message updated by client.
        See Also:
        showStatus(String, boolean, boolean), clearWaitingStatus(boolean), statusOKText

      • channel

        protected javax.swing.JTextField channel
        Chat channel name to create or join with joinChannelButton button. Hidden in v1.1.19+ if server is missing SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_CHANNELS.

      • chlist

        protected javax.swing.JList<soc.client.SwingMainDisplay.JoinableListItem> chlist
        List of chat channels that can be joined with joinChannelButton button or by double-click. Hidden in v1.1.19+ if server is missing SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_CHANNELS.

        When there are no channels, this list contains a single blank item (" ").

      • gmlist

        protected javax.swing.JList<soc.client.SwingMainDisplay.JoinableListItem> gmlist
        List of games that can be joined with joinGameButton button or by double-click, or detail info displayed with gameInfoButton button. Contains all games on server if connected, and any Practice Games created with practiceButton button.

        When there are no games, this list contains a single blank item (" ").

      • newGameButton

        protected javax.swing.JButton newGameButton
        "New Game..." button, brings up NewGameOptionsFrame window
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • joinChannelButton

        protected javax.swing.JButton joinChannelButton

      • SwingMainDisplay

        public SwingMainDisplay(boolean hasConnectOrPractice,
                        SOCPlayerClient client,
                        int displayScaleFactor)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new SwingMainDisplay for this client. Must call initVisualElements() after this constructor.
        Parameters:
        hasConnectOrPractice - True if should initially display SOCConnectOrPracticePanel and ask for a server to connect to, false if the server is known and should display the main panel (game list, channel list, etc).
        client - Client using this display; client.strings must not be null
        displayScaleFactor - Display scaling factor to use (1 if not high-DPI); caller should call checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component) with the Frame to which this display will be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if client is null or displayScaleFactor < 1

    • Method Detail

      • getForegroundBackgroundColors

        public static java.awt.Color[] getForegroundBackgroundColors(boolean isForLightBG,
                                                             boolean wantSystemColors)
        Get foreground and background colors to use for a new window or panel, unless OS is using high-contrast or reverse-video colors (accessibility).

        The first time this is called, attempts to determine if the OS is using a high-contrast or reverse-video mode (might detect only on Windows); if so, windows and panels should probably use the OS default colors.

        To check whether the OS is using such a mode, call isOSColorHighContrast().

        Parameters:
        isForLightBG - True for a light background like DIALOG_BG_GOLDENROD, false for a dark background like JSETTLERS_BG_GREEN
        wantSystemColors - True to return the default system-theme colors (not always accurate) from SystemColor.textText and SystemColor.text instead of JSettlers colors. If true: Won't return null, and ignores isForLightBG.
        Returns:
        Array of 3 colors: { Main foreground, misc foreground, background }, or null if OS is using high-contrast or reverse-video colors. If background is dark, misc foreground is MISC_LABEL_FG_OFF_WHITE instead of same as main foreground Color.BLACK.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • isOSColorHighContrast

        public static boolean isOSColorHighContrast()
        Is the OS using high-contrast or reverse-video colors (accessibility mode)? If so, to get those colors call getForegroundBackgroundColors(false, true).
        Returns:
        true if high-contrast or reverse instead of usual JSettlers colors
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • checkDisplayScaleFactor

        public static int checkDisplayScaleFactor(java.awt.Component c)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        For use on high-DPI displays, determine if the screen resolution is tall enough that our unscaled (1x) component sizes, window sizes, and font sizes would be too small to comfortably use.

        Returns a high-DPI scaling factor if screen height is at least twice DISPLAY_MIN_UNSCALED_HEIGHT. Called at startup, available afterwards from getDisplayScaleFactor().

        After determining scale here, be sure to call scaleUIManagerFonts(int) once.

        If user preference SOCPlayerClient.PREF_UI_SCALE_FORCE or system property PROP_JSETTLERS_UI_SCALE are set to an integer >= 1, they override this display check and that value will be returned, even if c is null or hasn't been added to a Container.

        Parameters:
        c - Component; not null
        Returns:
        scaling factor based on screen height divided by DISPLAY_MIN_UNSCALED_HEIGHT, or 1 if cannot determine height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if c isn't a top-level Container and hasn't yet been added to a Container
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if c is null
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • scaleUIManagerFonts

        public static void scaleUIManagerFonts(int displayScale)
        If not already done, scale the UI look-and-feel font sizes for use on high-DPI displays. Helps keep buttons, labels, text fields legible. Sets a flag to ensure scaling is done only once, to avoid setting 4x or 8x font sizes. Assumes UIManager.setLookAndFeel(String) has already been called.
        Parameters:
        displayScale - Scale factor to use, from checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component); if 1, makes no changes to font sizes.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String cpass,
                    java.lang.String cuser)
        Prepare to connect, give feedback by showing MESSAGE_PANEL. Prepare to connect and give feedback by showing a message panel. Stores the given username and password in the user interface.

        Does not make a network connection. Call ClientNetwork#connect(String, int) when ready to make the connection.

        User login and authentication don't occur until a game or channel join is requested; at that time, the user interface will read the name and password stored here.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface MainDisplay
        Parameters:
        cpass - Password text to put into that TextField (obscured)
        cuser - User nickname text to put into that TextField

      • getValidNickname

        protected java.lang.String getValidNickname(boolean precheckOnly)
        Trim, validate, and return the nickname textfield if valid. If successful, can also set SOCPlayerClient nickname fields. May set status bar to a hint message if textfield is empty, such as NEED_NICKNAME_BEFORE_JOIN.

        Unless precheckOnly:

        • Sets SOCPlayerClient.nickname field
        • Sets SOCPlayerClient.practiceNickname field if that field is null
        Parameters:
        precheckOnly - If true, only validate the name, don't set nickname client-object fields
        Returns:
        Validated nickname from textfield, or null if blank or not successfully validated
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        readValidNicknameAndPassword()

      • getPassword

        protected java.lang.String getPassword()
        Validate and return the password textfield contents; may be 0-length, or null if invalid. Also set #password field to the value returned from this method. If #gotPassword already, return current password without checking textfield. If text is too long, sets status text and sets focus to password textfield.
        Returns:
        The trimmed password field text (may be ""), or null if invalid or too long
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        readValidNicknameAndPassword()

      • gameWithOptionsBeginSetup

        public void gameWithOptionsBeginSetup(boolean forPracticeServer,
                                      boolean didAuth)
        Want to start a new game, on a server which supports options. Do we know the valid options already? If so, bring up the options window. If not, ask the server for them. If a NewGameOptionsFrame is already showing, give it focus instead of creating a new one.

        For a summary of the flags and variables involved with game options, and the client/server interaction about their values, see ServerGametypeInfo.

        Updates tcpServGameOpts, practiceServGameOpts, newGameOptsFrame.

        Specified by:
        gameWithOptionsBeginSetup in interface MainDisplay
        Parameters:
        forPracticeServer - Ask ClientNetwork#practiceServer, instead of TCP server?
        didAuth - If true, the server has authenticated our username and password; set those input fields read-only.
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • showVersion

        public void showVersion(int vers,
                        java.lang.String versionString,
                        java.lang.String buildString,
                        SOCFeatureSet feats)
        After connecting, display the remote server's version on main panel, and update display based on its active SOCFeatureSet. Not called for practice server. If we're running a server, display its listening port # instead.

        showVersion calls initMainPanelLayout(false, feats) to complete layout of the Main Panel with the server's version and active features.

        Specified by:
        showVersion in interface MainDisplay
        Parameters:
        vers - Version number, like 1119, from server's Version.versionNumber()
        versionString - Version string, like "1.1.19", from server's Version.version()
        buildString - Build number, from server's Version.buildnum()
        feats - Active optional server features; never null. If server is older than v1.1.19, use the SOCFeatureSet(true, true) constructor.

      • startLocalTCPServer

        public void startLocalTCPServer(int tport)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Setup for locally hosting a TCP server. If needed, a local server and robots are started, and client connects to it, then visually indicate we are in Server Mode and port number. If the ClientNetwork#localTCPServer is already created, does nothing. If connected already, does nothing.

        If parent is a Frame, sets titlebar to show "server" and port number. Shows port number in versionOrlocalTCPPortLabel.

        Specified by:
        startLocalTCPServer in interface MainDisplay
        Parameters:
        tport - TCP port number to host on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If port is 0 or negative
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already connected to a server
